msgSnippet: JDepend 1.4, the freely-available Java package dependency analyzer,  has been released.  Of particular interest to JUnit users is the ability to write tests

Subject: Announce: JDepend 1.4

From: Mike Clark <mike@...>

JDepend 1.4, the freely-available Java package dependency analyzer,  has
been released.  Of particular interest to JUnit users is the ability to
write tests that automatically check metrics tolerances, existence of
package dependency cycles, and package dependency constraints.


New Features:

- Added package dependency constraints to support writing tests that
fail if any package dependency other than those declared in the
dependency constraints are detected.  Refer to the documentation or the
jdepend.framework.ConstraintTest class for complete examples.

  For example, the following test case method will fail if the analyzed
packages contain any dependencies other than those declared in the
dependency constraint:

    public void testDependencyConstraint() {

        JavaPackage ejb = new JavaPackage("com.xyz.ejb");
        JavaPackage web = new JavaPackage("com.xyz.web");
        JavaPackage util = new JavaPackage("com.xyz.util");

        ejb.dependsUpon(util);
        web.dependsUpon(util);

        DependencyConstraint constraint = new DependencyConstraint();
        constraint.addPackage(ejb);
        constraint.addPackage(web);
        constraint.addPackage(util);

        _jdepend.analyze();

        assert(_jdepend.dependencyMatch(constraint));
    }

- Added the jdepend.xmlui.JDepend class to generate package metrics,
dependencies, and cycles in an XML format for easier integration with
other tools.

  Example usage:
      java jdepend.xmlui.JDepend -file report.xml /myproject/src


The JDepend documentation is available at

       http://www.clarkware.com/software/JDepend.html

JDepend 1.4 can be downloaded directly from

       http://www.clarkware.com/software/jdepend1.4.zip


Any feedback you may have is most welcome and appreciated.

Thanks and enjoy!

Mike

Mike Clark
